Il  fait le commerce de boutique (savon, habits, babouches,…)    depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de babouches, de savons, d' habits,… à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire une maison en matériaux durables, acheter une voiture et    voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Bernard  is a member of the Humuriza Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  He is fifty-two years old and married to Necelate, who works as a vegetable grower.  Together they have six children, aged between twelve and twenty-five years.  All their children attend school.  He is also responsible for another child, who is a member of his extended family, and is studying.

Bernard has sold various products (soap, clothes, slippers, etc) from his shop, for six years.  This will be his fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  He plans to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy slippers, soap and clothing.  He will then sell these products to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Bernard would like to build a solid and long-lasting house, buy a car and provide for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, soap and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ingoma Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Ingoma  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 41 ans et est marié  à Eliza, une cultivatrice.  

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (sucre, farine de sorgho, farine de maïs,…) depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (sucre, farine de sorgho, farine de maïs,…)   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter des terrains cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jérôme belongs to the Ingoma group and lives in Rumonge. He is 41 years old and married to Eliza, who is a farmer.

He has been selling products in a shop (sugar, sorghum flour, cornflour, etc.) for the past five years and is on his fourth loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of these products for his shop, which he will resell to make more money.

In the coming years he would like to buy some farmable land and see his children have an education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (sugar, sorghum flour, cornflour) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галине 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 5 детей. Все дети проживают самостоятельно и отдельно, кроме младшего сына, он проживает вместе с родителями. Супруг помогает Галине по хозяйству. У Галины - средне-специальное образование. Семья Галины после распада СССР начала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Галина занимается полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Галины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: земельный надел размером 2,20 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер и фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дополнительного развития своего хозяйства, Галина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку одной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, за счет получения молока от коровы Галина намерена увеличить доходы своей семьи и параллельно заниматься как полеводством, так и животноводством. Доходы от кредита Галина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники домой.
texts.en:
Galina is 59 years old, married, and together with her spouse raised five children. All the children reside independently and separately, except for the youngest son who lives with his parents. Galina's husband helps her around the homestead. Galina has a secondary specialized education. Galina's family, after the fall of the USSR, began to engage in agriculture. As a main source of income for her family, Galina raises crops, having begun 23 years ago with 5,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to her hard work, Galina currently has on her homestead: arable land measuring 2.20 hectares, on which she grows clover and beans for sale. Monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS). With the aim of additional development of her homestead, Galina applied to the microfinacne bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase one cow to increase her livestock count. By collecting milk from a cow, Galina intends to increase income for her family and in parallel to engage in crop cultivation and animal husbandry. 

Galina plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the count of domestic animals, and plans to save money to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. 

She and her husband have been growing chilies and also working as paid workers for 10 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Rom’s group consists of two members who are female. She is a fourth-cycle client while her co-member is new with Kiva’s partner Vision Fund. She has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve its financial burden and improve its livelihood. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Rom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her chilies. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her chilies.

loans.name: Savean's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Savean is 40-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. 

She and her husband are rice farmers. Having been in the business for five years, she can make daily income from her current business of 20,000 KHR and is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

Savean has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her current business. 

Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Savean will use her portion to pay for harvesting the rice fields. She hopes to earn more income from the rice paddy.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting the rice fields.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU ont en moyenne 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des  grains de céréales et de la  restauration.
 Les femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU sont à leur  1er   prêt solidaire. SAFI 2 eme  femme à  la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kg de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA pendant les jours des foires. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et  à la nourriture aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Fasso Kanou Group have an average age of 36 and an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Bla, located in the fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

The women know each other because they are related. They work buying and selling cereals and in the food-serving business. This is the first group loan for the women of the Fasso Kanou Group.

Safi is the second woman on the right in the photo. She plans to use this loan to buy 100 kilos of fonio [a species of millet]. She buys her supplies in Bla on market days. She sells to both men and women, in cash and also often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 14,000 francs CFA, which will be used for health, food and school expenses. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fonio [a species of millet].

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 9 years to 14 years. She describes herself as determined and focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea for sale. She has been in this business for six years. She also keeps dairy cows to earn extra income.

She has taken a loan of KES 25,000 to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family of five store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Tabita is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling yam tubers and other petty trading items in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. 

Tabita is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Tabita wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of tubers of yam. In the long term, Tabita plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand by traveling to the northern part of Ghana to buy the yams since they are cheaper there and resell them in the southern part.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of yam tubers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria operates a business selling soft drinks in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Victoria is a widow with 4 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Victoria uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Victoria will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of crates of soda (Fanta, Coke, and Sprite), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.  As a middle school graduate, Victoria understands the importance of education for improving social conditions, and she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all of her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of crates of soda (Fanta, Coke, and Sprite), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Néstor

texts.es:
Néstor es transportista de la ciudad de Pilar, está casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia, su esposa es funcionaria pública de esa ciudad.
El señor Néstor realiza viajes diarios transportando pasajeros desde varios puntos de la ciudad. Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias y con más de 10 años de experiencia en el trabajo que hace. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para reparar el motor de su trasporte y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar cada día. 
Néstor agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Néstor has a transportation business in the city of Pilar.  He is married, has two children and lives in his own house.  His wife is a civil servant in the city.  Néstor transports passengers on a daily basis to different parts of the city.  He is a hard worker with good references and has been in business for over ten years.

The loan he is requesting is to repair the engine of his vehicle so he can continue working and struggling to improve his daily lifestyle.  Néstor is grateful for the opportunity to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: San Pablo Apostol Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que han visto una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de comité de mujeres, es por eso que decidieron unirse, para poder trabajar juntas.
La señora Pascuala es integrante del comité, ella es casada y cuenta con una pequeña mercería, donde vende todo tipo de productos con lo cual surte su barrio y da a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y creciendo, y ve una gran oportunidad de seguir creciendo por medio del grupo.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, zapatos, artículos de bazar y demás. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group are hard-working, determined women who have seen the great growth opportunity in the communal bank, so they decided to band and work together.

One of the members of the group, Pascuala, is married and has a small shop where she sells all kinds of products to people in the neighborhood, including everything her customers need.  Through her work and efforts she has improved and grown, and sees a great opportunity to continue expanding through the group.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes, trinkets and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity all the members are receiving so they can improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, trinkets and other items.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est né vers 1980 à Bougouni. Père de 4 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 9 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  7 eme prêt maintenant, les six prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages de Garalo et environs. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de Sikasso et de Bamako et souvent Adama les transporte à Bamako au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa was born around 1980 in Bougouni. The father of four, he lives in a traditional family in the Torakabougou district in Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been running a business selling grains for over nine years. His experience in this domain has earned him a good reputation. He receives orders for grains, especially corn and sorghum. So, to obtain the necessary resources for satisfying his customers, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his seventh loan. The six previous loan were correctly repaid. 

This loan will enable him to purchase 5 tonnes of corn and a tonne of sorghum. He gets his supplies from the villages of Garalo and nearby. The grains are stocked in a store for a certain time. He resells them for cash to a customer base composed of men and women from Sikasso and Bamako and often Adama. He transports them to Bamako as needed. 

With this loan, he envisions making an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. This profit will allow him to pay the loan interest and invest the rest in his business. He plans on becoming a wholesaler in Bougouni.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Washizu

texts.en:
Washizu is 20 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has two years of experience in this line of business.

Washizu needs a loan to buy materials, threads, zippers, buttons and an overlock machine. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, zippers, buttons and an overlock machine.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a Kiva borrower who is 41 years old and married. She has four children. She describes herself as focused. 

She sells cereals to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. 

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. The tank will benefit six family members. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jermaine

texts.en:
Jermaine worked in the corporate world for more than 20 years until he grew tired and decided to start his own business. He opened Serenity Adult Day Care in his hometown of San Antonio, Texas.

His family has been in the care-giving industry for 15 years, and it was during those years that Jermaine was raised to learn how to care for others. His center, Jermaine says, caters to senior citizens as well as mentally challenged adults. He says family members of his clients compliment him on the cleanliness of his facility, but he credits his success to his friendly staff members, who are knowledgeable and experienced. 

Serenity Adult Day Care has been operating for 14 months. After a recent Google search, Jermaine went to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to license his business through the state, hire someone to install handicapped-friendly bars, adjust sprinkler heads, and make plumbing modifications.

Once he is licensed, Jermaine plans to have 10 times the clients and create at least four new jobs.

Without the loan, Jermaine says, “I wouldn't get my license, I would not be able to add more clients, and I would eventually be out of business.”

“I thank Accion and look forward to a long relationship with them,” he says.

loans.use: to license his business through the state, hire someone to install handicapped-friendly bars, adjust sprinkler heads, and make plumbing modifications.

loans.name: Las 3 Amigas Group

texts.es:
Rudy, tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive con sus padres en Olanchito. Ella estuvo estudiando, luego logro dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos, plásticos, cosméticos, cremas y electrodomésticos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo en forma grupal, particularmente es por 7,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de mercadería como ropa, zapatos, y electrodomésticos para vender y poder crecer y mejorar los ingresos. Su plan es tener un negocio grande para sacar a su familia adelante. 
El grupo se llama Las 3 Amigas y lo integran tres personas, quienes viven en la misma comunidad, se dedican al comercio y están solicitando 7,000 Lempiras cada uno, haciendo un total de 21,000 lempiras para surtir sus negocios de mercadería y aumentar las ventas. En la foto esta Rudy de blusa blanca, en medio esta José y a la derecha esta Melba.
texts.en:
Rudy, 20, is a single mother with a son and she lives with her parents in Olanchito.  She used to be a student and then began working as a merchant selling clothing, shoes, plastics, cosmetics, creams and domestic appliances.  She works as a street vendor taking orders.  The loan she is requesting through the communal bank is her fourth and the amount is for 7,000 HNL which she will use to buy clothing, shoes and domestic appliances to sell and improve her income.

Her goal is to have a larger business to support the family.  The communal bank, called "Las Tres Amigas" is comprised of three people who all live in the same community.  They are all merchants and each one is requesting 7,000 HNL for a total 21,000 HNL  This is to stock their businesses and increase sales.

In the photograph Rudy is the one in the white blouse, José is in the middle and Melba is on the right.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and domestic appliances to sell.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar is a bachelor degree student who studies in a public university as a scholar and interpreter of Chinese language. She desperately needed this money in order to pay for tuition fee. If she did not get this loan, she would have to take a year off from the university. She is a very passionate and hardworking student. Therefore, missing one year would be a huge gap for her academic performance.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She also grows and harvests coconut and sells it in town. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used to improve the farm. To restore soil fertility, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. In the future, Charlyn hopes to improve her house for a comfortable living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 41 years old and married to a photographer who earns income when hired for special occasions. With her desire to help him, Jesusa started a livestock business raising hogs. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more feed to ensure that her hogs reach their optimum growth in a healthy and efficient manner.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Mutabazi Group

texts.fr:
Oscar  fait partie du groupe  Mutabazi  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 38 ans et est marié  à Anastasie, une  cultivatrice.  

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (huile de palme, haricot, riz,…) depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (huile de palme, haricot, riz,…)  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire une maison annexe dans sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Oscar is part of the group Mutabazi and lives in Rumonge. He is 38 years old and married to Anastasie, a farmer. 

Oscar has been running a store (palm oil, beans, rice, …) for six years. He is on his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many goods for his store (palm oil, beans, rice, …) to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to build house annex on his plot of land and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many store goods (palm oil, beans, rice, ...) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Bubira

texts.ru: Бубире 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. По характеру Бубира -добрая, отзывчивая и трудолюбивая. Супруг находится на заработках в России. Бубира проживает вместе со свекром и свекровью. Они очень хорошо отзываются о своей невестке. У Бубиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубира занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с суммы в 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубиры и ее семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также земельный надел размером 2,10 ГА, а также они арендуют около 3,0 ГА земли у односельчан. На своей плодотворной земельной доле Бубира выращивает множество видов овощей для реализации, такие как: картофель, помидоры, огурцы, кукурузу, арбузы. Землю постоянно обрабатывают, поэтому урожай всегда хороший. Урожай Бубира реализует оптовым продавцам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дополнительного развития своего хозяйства, Бубира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма и разведения. Бубира знает тонкости животноводства, поэтому она планирует развести скот. Доходы от кредита Бубира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на обеспечение сына всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Bubira is 23 years old, married, and with her husband is raising on son. By character, Bubira is kind, responsive and hardworking. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. Bubira resides with her in-laws. They respond very well to their daughter-in-law. Bubira has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Bubira is involved with crop cultivation and raising livestock, having begun two years ago with a sum of 15,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to the hard work of Bubira and her family, they currently have on their homestead: two dairy cows, arable land measuring 2.10 hectares, and also they rent around 3.0 hectares of land to fellow villagers. On her fruitful share of land, Bubira grows many types of vegetables for sale, such as: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbes, corn, and watermelons. The earth is continually re-worked, therefore the harvest is always good. Bubira's crop is sold to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of additional development of her homestead, Bubira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase bulls for fattening and breeding. Bubira knows the specifics of animal husbandry, therefore she plans to breed cattle. 

Bubira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the count of domestic animals, and intends to save money to support her son with all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and breeding

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз позитивная и дружелюбная женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она живёт вместе со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке.  Дилафруз с детства имела желание научиться готовить разные блюда. Она многому научилась у своей матери. На сегодня этот опыт помогает ей зарабатывать деньги. Для того, чтобы иметь доход в семье, она занимается своим бизнесом. Дилафруз продаёт различные салаты и соленья, которые  приготавливает самостоятельно. Этим делом она занимается вот уже как 3 года. Он также является клиентом Арванд. Первый свой кредит она получила как раз для  того, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Сейчас Дилафруз необходимо закупить ещё продуктов и разных специи для приготовления очередной партии салатов для продажи. Для этого она в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку продуктов и специй. Дилафруз надеется на положительный результат  и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a positive and outgoing woman of 40 years. She lives with her family in a rural village. Since childhood, Dilafruz has had the desire to learn to cook different dishes. She learned a lot from her mother. Today this experience helps her to earn a living. In order to have an income for her family, she engages in her own business. Dilafruz sells various salads and pickles, which she prepares herself. She has been engaged in this work for three years. 

She is a repeat client of Arvand. Her first loan was received in order to start a business. Now, Dilafruz needs to purchase more products and different spices to prepare another batch of salads for sale. For this, she has once again appealed to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy products and spices. Dilafruz needs a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase products and spices

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 56 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Асатулло домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Асатулло работает продавцом мужской одежды на центральном рынке. Этим бизнесом он занимается вот уже несколько лет  и получает хорошую прибыль. Но этого дохода хватает Асатулло только на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, он хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. И для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Асатулло  обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Асатулло  надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Asatullo is a positive and responsible man of 56. He is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a small village. But the house in which they live is quite small and not quite well-constructed for good living in it. Asatullo's wife is a homemaker. She is a very hardworking and loving mother. Asatullo himself works as a salesman of men's clothing in the central market. He has been involved in this business for several years and receives a good income. But this income provides Asatullo only with a subsistence. 

He has dreams: he wants to build a large home for his family. And for this, he needs cash. That which he earns is insufficient to afford building a new home. Therefore, Asatullo turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase building materials for построения дома. Asatullo hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sophal is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are in school while another two are too young for school. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for ten years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day.

Sophal is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and plow the field. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Choert's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 years, Choert is widowed and lives with her five children in a rural area located in the Srey Smom district of Siem Reap province. 

She has made a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 15 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Choert has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. She is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting her rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting her rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Pho Realz?!'s last Kiva loan gave them the boost they needed to get their budding business off the ground. As their pop-up noodle business has grown, they are now seeking a second $10,000 Kiva loan to purchase the equipment needed for an additional food tent, enabling them to be at multiple locations simultaneously. They are confident that their business will experience growth in the coming year with the help of Kiva lenders!

Working as a husband and wife team, Cindy and Ves created a mobile food tent which capitalized on their mutual love for South-East Asian food—in particular, pho or Vietnamese rice noodles.  Their shared passion for food instilled in them a desire to provide an experience defined by quality service and authentic delicious food. Although they both loved the idea of opening a food truck, they decided to start small with a food tent instead.  They have since been sharing their love of Pho at farmers markets throughout the San Diego area.

Financial capital has been the chief hurdle that Cindy and her husband have had to overcome.  Furthermore, Cindy shared that their biggest struggle is getting the word out about their unique, local food tent. Regardless of the obstacles, she says that they both enjoy the challenge and are committed to the long-term success of their business.

Cindy finds value and passion in partnering with the local community and giving back, explaining that she has a deep appreciation for a locally oriented, hospitable mindset. She hopes in the future that her business can continue to share a love of different cultures while working with the community.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed for an additional food tent

loans.name: Muvafe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Muvafe está en el 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se unieron para poder mejorar sus vidas y poder ayudar a sus hijos.
Sergia es una de ellas, y se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades, termos forrados y otros,  y el crédito que pide lo utilizará para la compra de insumos varios, como pegamento, cuero, pinzas, hilos y demás. 
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que hace a cada una de las integrantes del grupo. Todas quieren mejorar en la actividad que hacen.
texts.en:
The communal bank MUVAFE is in its second loan cycle.  All the members of the group joined together to improve their lifestyles and help their children.  Sergia is one of the members and she works making crafts, including covered thermos bottles.  The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies such as glue, leather, clips, thread and other items.

Worth mentioning is the hard work of the counselors who are continuously following up on the training and verification of the members in the group.  All of them want to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy glue, leather, clips, thread and other craft supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth operates a provision shop in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Elizabeth is a single. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family, thus her parents and siblings. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of Milo, powdered milk (nido), candies, biscuits, and bags of sugar and rice, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. 

As a senior high school graduate, Elizabeth understands the importance of education in improving social conditions. Thus, she plans to save and use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that she continues her schooling in the near future. Also, she will put some of the profit into her new doughnut-baking business.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of Milo, powdered milk (nido), candies, biscuits, bags of sugar and rice, thus aiding in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina is a small scale provision seller in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school level graduate. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver by profession. 

Philomina has been working as a provision seller for close to 7 years. She realized that her husband’s income alone would not sustain the home and their children’s schooling. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of tinned fish, tins of Milo, bags of rice, boxes of soap, and different kinds of canned drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all of her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of tinned fish, tins of Milo, bags of rice, boxes of soap, and different kinds of canned drinks.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.en:
Sylvanus is married to a teacher. He has 2 children. He uses his income to help his wife pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle school level graduate, Sylvanus currently operates a local auto mechanic shop in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe).  

With over 7 years of experience in this trade, Sylvanus sees an opportunity to expand his enterprise further. Nevertheless, he does not have the working capital necessary to increase his quantity of stock. Thus, his loan will be used to buy different sizes of used car tires and inner tubes for resale and to pay for electricity, which will indirectly help him boost his overall sales. 

Sylvanus wants to make his business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, he plans to channel the new profits from his expanded business back into his car tire business and buy a new air pulping machine.

loans.use: to buy different sizes of used car tires and inner tubes for resale and to pay for electricity.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is married to a peasant farmer. She has 4 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle school level graduate, Melody currently cooks and sells rice balls and palm nut soup in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe).  

With over 5 years of experience in this trade, Melody sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, local red rice, palm fruits, onions, and cartons of fish and meat, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. 

Melody wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her food business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, local red rice, palm fruits, onions, and cartons of fish and meat.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey  está en su 6to. ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, mediante el cual podrán ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Lida, una integrante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y comenta que gracias a que siempre tiene muy buena variedad es que le está yendo muy bien, ya que se hizo de muy buena clientela.  Su meta es poder llegar a tener un negocio amplio y ahí poder hacer sus ventas y seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Pide hoy este préstamo ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank KUÑA KYREY is in its sixth loan cycle and all the members are committed to working and helping each other get ahead.  They form part of the poverty elimination program aimed at improving their situation.  

One of the members of the group is Lida who sells cosmetics.  She says that thanks to the fact that she always has a wide variety of products sales are going well and she has many customers.  Her goal is to expand her business, increase sales and continue working to prosper.

The loan she is requesting is to buy different cosmetics so she can continue with her sales activity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Faataualofa

texts.en:
Faataualofa is 33 years old and lives with her partner and two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Faataualofa needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, taro roots, and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

 Faataualofa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, taro roots, and chemicals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Nora has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a pickaxe, a digging stick, a shovel and a backpack sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Nora hopes to support her family and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a pickaxe, a digging stick, a shovel and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Foloi

texts.en:
Foloi is a 52-year-old divorced woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Foloi has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush-knives, a pickaxe, taro roots, a backpack sprayer and a tarpaulin. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Foloi hopes to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush-knives, a pickaxe, taro roots, a backpack sprayer and a tarpaulin

loans.name: Pendyore

texts.en: Pendyore is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chicken, soy sauce, onions, rice, etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Pendyore needs a loan to buy chicken, rice,  flour, noodles, mosquito coils, milk, soap, soft drinks and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice,  flour, noodles, mosquito coils, milk, soap, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 25-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Naomi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, bush knives and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Naomi hopes to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weedsprayer, bush knives and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala, a 52-year-old married mother of six, has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years.

A member of SPBD since 2007, Kalala is requesting a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow and gloves. 
She will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en: Rema is a farmer in her village. She and her husband work hand and hand to develop their business. Rema hopes for smooth flow of her farming business to be able to give her family a better income and comfortable living situation. However, insufficiency of capital hampers the execution of her farming business. To make it run better, she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 12,000. This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay  labor costs for transplanting seedlings to her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay  labor costs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Agnes engages in the cooking and selling of meals and snacks within her community. She is 36 years old and has one school-age child. She aims to earn and save more income in order to satisfy her family's necessities and support the education of their child. 

Due to insufficient capital, Agnes is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and other ingredients needed in her food vending business. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables and other ingredients needed  in her food vending business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has a general store as her business. She is 38 years of age, married and has one child. Her husband works abroad as a company driver. 

Jocelyn started her business with direct-selling of beauty products in their village. When she got tired of doing her daily routine, which was house-to-house delivery of products she offered, she decided to manage a sari-sari store business where she could also display her cosmetic products. At present, she has low stocks of grocery items in her store due to crisis and most of her customers get the products on credit. So she is in need of additional capital amounting to 50,000 PHP to buy grocery items and mobile load to sell. She will do her best in managing the business to grow and prosper.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and mobile load to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena  owns and operates a retail business in the market to earn a living. She has been selling meat for many years and she earns well for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used that loan to improve her business. 

Currently, she has taken out a new loan to purchase more meat and other items to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and other items to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní gracias a la iniciativa de una de las integrantes, quienes decidieron formar parte del programa. Todas las integrantes son feriantes y tienen un local bien equipado donde ofrecen sus productos de su propia producción como huevo, leche, queso, frutas, y todos los productos agrícolas. 
Ceferiana pide este préstamo para poder comprar huevo y leche, para poder venderlos en la feria y seguir trabajando
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee was formed when a number of neighbors from the city of Santaní joined forces. Thanks to the initiative of one of the members, they decided to join the program. Each member has a stall in a well-equipped facility where they sell their products which they produce themselves such as eggs, milk, cheese, fruit, and all kinds of agricultural products. 

Ceferiana is asking for this loan so that she may buy eggs and milk to sell at the market and continue working.

loans.use: to buy eggs and milk for sale

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is 39 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells siapo, kava bowls, earrings, bangles, two-piece dresses, etc. to earn a living and has been doing this for three years.

Muia has requested a loan to buy materials, pandanus leaves, traditional tapa cloth, needles, chicken feathers and kava bowls. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family with everyday needs and wants. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, pandanus leaves, traditional tapa cloth, needles,  chicken feathers and kava bowls

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 51 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as milk, sugar, rice, flour, soap, etc. She has been doing this for 27 years.

Lise needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, boxes of tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, cooking oil, chop suey noodles, soy sauce, spaghetti, toilet paper and diapers. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, boxes of tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, cooking oil, chop suey noodles, soy sauce, spaghetti, toilet paper and diapers

loans.name: Tuiga

texts.en:
Tuiga is 22 years old and single, with no children. To earn a living, she makes and sells 'elei lavalava' (painted fabric) and she has been doing this for two years.

Tuiga has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric paints, elei, carved board, and stencils. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, elei, carved board, and stencils.

loans.name: Hector Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio Hector se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,el socio ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar parabrisas,siliconas y llantas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Hector continues to manages a business of selling automobile parts.  He has been in business for several years and is doing very well.  His dream is to expand his auto parts business.  

Hector is requesting a loan in order to buy windshields, silicone, and tires.  He appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy windshields, silicone, and tires.

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es: Zarela, de 60 años, es una mejer alegre, luchadora y perseverante, es madre  soltera.  Vive en casa propia junto a su hijo de 17 años a quien quiere, da una buena educación y calidad de vida. Zarela se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo tales como ropas, perfumes, electrodomésticos, este trabajo lo realiza desde su vivienda donde instalo un pequeño local en el cual exhibe sus diferentes productos. También sale a las calles en donde ofrece y reparte su mercadería entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, lleva con este trabajo más de 05 años, esta actividad económica la realiza sola. Se inicio en esta labor ya que no tenia el apoyo económico para la crianza de  su hijo por ello decidió salir adelante poniendo su propio negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tiempo para su hogar y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para su economía, siempre tiene clientes ya que los mantiene por que son muy buenos pagadores, espera mantenerse  y más adelante comprar una vitrina donde pueda mostrar sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600, esta tranquila con el grupo al que pertenece y espera poder continuar así. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos novedosos  tales como perfumes, ropas para niños, damas y caballeros etc.
texts.en:
Zarela is 60 years old. She is a fighter, happy and persevering. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her 17 year old son. She wants to give him a good education and good quality of living. Zarela sells goods from catalogs like clothing, perfume, electrical appliances. She does this work from her home where she has a small store where she displays her merchandise to friends, neighbors and family members. She has been doing this for more than 5 years and she works by herself. 

When she started doing this she had no economic support with which to raise her son so she decided to start her own business. What she likes about the work is that it leaves her time to care for the house and at the same time make some money. She has customers who she wants to keep as they are very good at paying. She hopes to keep them and later buy a display window to display her products. 

At this time Zarela is requesting a loan of 600 PEN. With that amount she will purchase new products like perfume, clothing for children, women and men. She is happy with the group she is in and hopes to continue in it.

loans.use: to buy products like perfume, clothing for children, women, men, etc.

loans.name: Enkhzaya

texts.en: Ms. Enkhzaya is a Bachelor's degree student who studies in a private university to be a programmer. She always wanted to be a programmer when she was young and this loan is helping her to pay tuition fees. She has mentioned that there would be no alternative options for her. She is very interested in this profession, thus she is working very hard to graduate successfully. She believes that gaining a good education is the most important thing in her life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Rufina Primitiva

texts.es:
Rufina tiene 49 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene tres hijos 19,20 y 25 años, vive solo vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Rufina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y el clima que no ayuda mucho.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza y liquidos para matar los insectos. La meta es tener dinero para comprar mas tierras y seguir sembrando para tener mas ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver la television y descanzar.
texts.en:
Rufina is 49 years old. She is in a committed relationship. She has three children, ages 19, 20, and 25. She lives alone in the Mocache canton in the Los Rios province. She is a member of the "27 de Octubre" communal bank, which is located in the Sara Guerrero precinct in the Mocache canton. Its members work in agriculture and livestock.

Rufina makes a living in agriculture by growing corn. She makes purchases in Mocache at the market on Thursdays. With the loan, she has been able to cover some necessities, like paying workers and obtaining some supplies. She faces challenges like competition and weather, which doesn't help much. 

She requests this loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed-killer, and insecticides. Her goal is to earn enough money to purchase more land, so that she can continue growing crops and earning more income. In her free time, she likes to watch television and rest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed-killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
A hard-working farmer, named Ernie, is 31 years of age. He is a father of one child. 

Right now, Ernie is operating his rice field to improve his living conditions. Ernie is now asking for a loan, in the amount of PHP 15,000, to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor used to transplant his farmland.

Immediately, Ernie would like to sow his farmland and carefully monitor his crops in order to avail a higher net income for this coming harvest season. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan in order to save and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor used to transplant his farmland.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es: Doña Neris es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada,la cual le ha permitido obtener mejores ingresos. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades y ha podido salir adelante. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Pacas de ropa usada. Con el fin de ofrecer una amplia variedad de ropa y expandir su negocio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque aumentara su negocio y podrá seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Neris is originally from the city of Estelí. She is a shopkeeper and sells used clothing, which has allowed her to earn more money.

She is thankful for Kiva and MiCredito, since she has been able to increase her profits and continue to move forward.

She requests another loan to purchase packs of used clothing so that she can continue to offer a wide variety of clothing and expand her business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful so that she can grow her business and continue to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase packs of used clothing.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación, está acompañado desde hace 18 años,  su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le colabora al cliente en la agricultura, sus tres hijos aún viven con ellos en casa y ellos están estudiando; pero también le colaboran en el trabajo agrícola que desempeña.


Él se dedica  a la agricultura y la ganadería, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 25 años el trabajo agrícola se lo enseño su padre,  quien desde muy pequeño le enseño la labor de sembrar el maíz, el frijol el maicillo, las hortalizas entre otras actividades propias de la agricultura  y la ganadería la aprendió de puro oficio propio de comercialización  del ganado. Juan también tiene como fuente de ingreso el jornal que lo desempeña en las épocas que no tiene trabajo propio, el trabajo del cliente está 4 kilómetros de distancia, el horario de trabajo del cliente es de 9 horas diarias.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar por el arrendamiento de la tierra para cultivar el maíz y el frijol también lo utilizara en poder limpiar y surcar la tierra donde sembrara,  el préstamo le ha asegurara el terreno donde sembrara en la temporada que ya se acerca, la necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener el lugar donde el cliente podrá seguir cultivando el sustento de la familia y así poder  asegurar la alimentación de su familia.

Su sueño para su negocio, es un día comprar su propio terreno  para cultivar,  todos los años  se ve en la necesidad de arrendar  terreno para cultivar, y para su familia ahorita tiene un sueño y es que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y se puedan graduar de algo que a ellos les guste.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old. He studied until the third grade. He has been married for 18 years, and his wife is a homemaker and helps him with agriculture. Their three children live at home with them and they are in school. They also help with agriculture.

He makes a living with agriculture and ranching. He has been doing this for 25 years. He learned to farm from his father, who taught him at a young age how to grow corn, beans, sorghum, and vegetables, as well as other activities related to agriculture. He taught himself the ranching business by selling cattle. Juan also earns income as a day laborer, which he does during the seasons where he does not have his own work to do. His job is located 4 kilometers away, and he works for 9 hours per day.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to pay rent on the land where he grows corn and beans. He will also use it to clear and plow the land. The loan will help him to secure the land where he will grow his crops in the upcoming season. He will be able to have a place to continue growing crops to sustain his family so that he can assure that his family will have the proper nutrition.

His dream for his business is to one day purchase his own land on which to grow crops. So far, he has needed to rent land to farm. Now, he has a dream for his family, which is for his children to go to college, graduate, and become what they want to be.

loans.use: to rent the land where he grows corn and beans, and to clear and plow the land.

loans.name: Ana Dermidia

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad, es abogado y notario,  está casada desde hace 9 años, el esposo es comerciante.  Trabaja en el municipio donde vive,  tienen en común 1 hijo el cual tiene 5 años de edad, vive con ellos aun y estudia parvularia.

En casa del cliente viven 4 personas incluyéndola a ella, pues también comparte el domicilio con la suegra quien se dedica a  los oficios domésticos en el hogar.  

Ella posee una farmacia desde hace 19 años, ya que su padre de ella le enseño a manejarlo, es un negocio de familia que viene trascendiendo desde hace 60 años y hoy en día es Ana quien lo administra.

Decide dedicarse a esto, porque aunque tiene una carrera universitaria el área donde vive no es demandada la profesión que ella tiene y prefiere dedicarse al comercio. Como su profesión, lo permite cuando tiene la oportunidad ella hace trabajos propios de abogacía esto le permite tener un ingreso adicional.

El negocio le queda a una distancia de  21 kilómetros que diariamente recorre en bus,  para llegar el horario de trabajo de la cliente es de 12 horas al día. 

 Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, comprara  medicamentos para surtir el negocio, ella en su negocio vende de todo tipo de medicamento para la salud humana y desea mejorar el inventario con nuevas y mejores medicinas que son demandados en el municipio donde tiene su negocio, esto vendrá a beneficiar a la gente y mejorara los ingresos de la cliente.

Ella sueña con dos cosas importantes en su vida, una de ellas es formar su propio bufete de abogados y desempeñar  la labor que le gusta;  pero además desea seguir manteniendo el negocio familiar que por tantos años le ha proveído de sus necesidades desea ampliarlo y llevarlo a los niveles más grandes.

Para su familia desea que su hijo y su familia estén en las mejores condiciones y trabajar fuerte para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ana, 36, is a lawyer and notary. She has been married for 9 years, and her husband is a retailer. She works in the city where she lives. They have a son who is currently five years old. He lives with them and is in nursery school. There are four people in her house, including her, since they also share the home with her mother-in-law, who takes care of the home.

Ana has had a pharmacy for 19 years. Her father taught her how to run it. It's a family business that has been passed down for 60 years and today, Ana manages it. She works in this sector because, although she has a university degree, her profession is not in demand in their area, and she prefers to work in retail. When she has the opportunity, she does legal work, which allows her to have an extra income. 

Her business is 21 kilometers away, a distance that she travels every day on the bus. She works 12 hours a day. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy medicines to stock her business. She sells all kinds of medicines for people's health and she wants to improve her inventory with new and improved medicines that are in demand in the area where her business is located. This will benefit the people and bring her more income. She has two important dreams for her life. One of them is to start her own law firm and do the work that she likes. But she also wants to maintain the family business that has provided for her needs for so many years. She wants to expand it and take it to a higher level. As for her family, she wants her son and family to live in the best conditions and she wants to work hard to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy medicines to stock her business

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is 26 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has a small farm where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her neighborhood or at the local market. She has been doing this for five years and is requesting this loan to buy a weed-sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and spades. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012 and plans to use the profits from her sales to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, pesticides, bush knives and spades.

loans.name: Kilifi

texts.en:
Rasela is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She makes and sells kava bowls, table mats, Samoan fans, etc., which she has been doing for three years.

Rasela is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy rolls of pandanus (a fiber made from screw-pine leaves), materials, kava bowls, earrings, and Samoan bangles. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of pandanus, materials, kava bowls, earrings, and Samoan bangles

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is single, but has two children. After successfully graduating from junior high school, Louis now operates a local restaurant. 

In Ve-Golokwat, near Hohoe, Louis prepares and sells banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, white, consistent paste) and fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou, another traditional Ghanaian dish which is made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle, until the desired consistency is reached. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup or other soups). 

Louis had been actively involved in this business for about three years when she realized that her children badly need her. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Louis uses her income to provide for the entire family. Louis will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava and corn dough, cassava and yam tuber for pounding fufu, cartons of chicken, meat, tin tomatoes, etc., thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Louis plans to diversify the type of food that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mística  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Del Pilar es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace, y que sale a vender de forma ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se está esforzando por poder mejorar su vida y las condiciones de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer comidas, como ser carne, verduras, hortalizas. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística group is in its first cycle in the program. It is from the city of Concepción which is somewhat isolated from the downtown area but is still growing. It is a region that is difficult to reach, so the members of this group want to fight to continue to grow and improve the environment where they live as they slowly grow.

Mrs. Del Pilar is one of the members and she sells food that she makes herself. She sells by going door to door.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is trying hard to improve her life and her family's living conditions. She is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients for the food she sells such as meat, greens, and vegetables. In this way she will be able to continue to grow her business and give her family what it needs to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy meat, greens, and vegetables to make food for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina owns and operates a general store selling  various products to earn a living. She has been doing it for six years, and she earns well for the family. To add to her income, she is trying another line of business, weaving nipa (palm frond) leaves into mats to resell and has been doing that for more than a year. 

In 2009, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She had her previous loan that she used in buying goods for her retail store and she has successfully repaid it. Currently, she has taken out a new loan to buy additional palm leaves.  In the future, Josefina wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional palm leaves

loans.name: Brendalee

texts.en: Due to financial insufficiency, Brendalee works at cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue in her community.She is 50 years old and has six children. She aims to improve her business so she can increase her income to help her husband in financing the education of her children and satisfy their daily needs. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the community. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to further improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads and feet, hot dogs and seasonings to cook and sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria tiene 57 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene dos hijos, vive la esposa u con los hijos vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y el clima que no ayuda mucho.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza y liquidos para matar los insectos. La meta es tener dinero para comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. They live in Mocache canton, part of Los Rios province. She belongs to the "27 DE OCTUBRE" communal bank which is located in Sara Guerrero village, Mocache canton. The members work in agriculture and raise animals. 

Maria grows corn. She buys her goods in Mocache at the Thursday market. With the money from the loan she can pay a few necessities like paying for labor and buying some supplies. Her challenges are the competition and the weather which doesn't help very much. 

With the loan Maria will buy fertilizer, seeds, fungicides and insecticides. Her goal is to have the money to buy a plot of land and continue to work in agriculture. She likes to listen to music in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is divorced and has three children. She sells plain rice and stew in Ve-Golokwati near Hohoe. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Florence uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Florence is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of rice, a gallon of oil, tinned tomatoes, a crate of eggs, and a carton of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a middle school graduate, Florence understands the importance of education in improving social conditions. Thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school. She also wants to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, a gallon of oil, tinned tomatoes, a crate of eggs, and a carton of fish

loans.name: Taotafa

texts.en: Taotafa is 58 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and other produce that she can sell in her community or at the local market. She has been doing this for two years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011 and will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en:
Falanika is a 37-year-old, widowed woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas, that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Falanika needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. Falanika will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation, support her family, and support her children's education, as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Sefulutasi

texts.en: Sefulutasi is 40 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei lavalava (handpainted cloth skirts) to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Sefulutasi has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
Sophany, 46, is married and a mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and three unmarried children in her own home while the other children are married and live separately in Prey Veng province. Sophany, together with her husband, is engaged in a farming business. She currently cultivates about one hectare of rice paddy and is able to earn approximately USD 3.66 per day.

As this is her first loan, Sophany aims to invest in the purchase of a solar panel system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Sophany will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can work or study even at night. This is thanks to the green loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL).

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar panel system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is divorced and has five children. After successfully graduating with a middle school certificate, Nora is now an established businesswoman. She sells charcoal, kerosene, cassava dough, sugar cane, and canned tomatoes in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 13 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Nora uses her income to provide for the entire family. Nora will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, kerosene, cassava dough, and canned tomatoes, which will help her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nora plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences. She also plans to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, kerosene, cassava dough, and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en: Silivia is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small farm where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers and beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years, and is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, including seeds, fertilizers, bush knives and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012 and hopes to use her profits to add to her savings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mark Gil

texts.en: Mark Gil is studying Computer Hardware Services at C-LAN Institute of Technology. He had a part time job harvesting lemons to earn an extra income that he would use for his needs. He joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester. He is hopeful to become successful in his studies to be able to help his family and community.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta is 21 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a kerosene oven, a frying pan, containers, dripping oil and salt. In the future, Henrietta hopes to improve her business and support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene oven, a frying pan, containers, dripping oil and salt

loans.name: Sofarania

texts.en: Sofarania is 33 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption items such as rice, flour, sugar, salt, chicken legs, mutton flaps etc. She has been doing this for five years. Sofarania needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a bag of flour, salt and a freezer. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, a bag of flour, salt and a freezer

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia is 25 years old, single and the mother of two children. She has a small farm where she grows taro, yams, bananas and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, knives, weedkiller, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009  and plans to use her profits to expand her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yeny Carolina

texts.es:
Yeny de 26 años de edad,  estudio hasta quinto grado de educación. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo quien vive en casa de ella aun no estudia, tiene 3 años de edad.

En casa del cliente viven cuatro personas 2 hermanas,  las cuales se dedican al comercio individual en la misma comunidad,  también viven sus padres los cuales se dedican a la agricultura todos dependen de sí mismo porque todos trabajan, de la cliente dependen nada más su hijo.


Ella administra su propio cafetín, en la misma comunidad donde vive,  tiene 6 años de tenerlo. el negocio lo aprendió sola un día decidió poner un puesto de venta en la comunidad, porque observo que no habían tiendas y la gente buscaba productos que solo en la ciudad se pueden conseguir, entonces decide un día comprar artículos de primera necesidad para vender y es así como puso su puesto de venta, el negocio de la cliente está cerca de su casa camina 2 cuadras para llagar y va a la ciudad a traer mercadería 3 veces por semana recorre 35 kilómetros, para acercarlos hasta su casa cuando la cliente no puede estar en el negocio también le apoya una hermana de ella, su horario de trabajo es de 12 horas al día de lunes a domingo.


Comprará con el préstamo productos de primera necesidad para la venta como  jabón, detergentes, papel higiénico, arroz, frijol, etc. El préstamo mejorara su vida porque tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y podrá satisfacer algunas necesidades que tiene su hijo y cubrir necesidades puntuales en su casa.
La necesidad  a satisfacer será cubrir la demanda que tiene en la comunidad  y ampliar su negocio 

Sus sueños son hacer crecer su negocio, comprando nuevos productos para la venta y que la gente necesita.
Para su familia desea ver que se superen con esfuerzo y trabajo porque es la única manera, desea que su hijo crezca en un  ambiente sano, estudie y desea ayudarlos a que alcancen sus sueños. El préstamo le ayudara a surtir de mejor manera su negocio y cubrir la demanda que tiene dentro de la comunidad  y pretende ampliar su negocio poniendo un puesto de venta, en la ciudad para tener una mejor ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeny is 26 and has studied up to fifth grade. She is a single mother and she has one child, who lives at home with her. He does not yet go to school as he is only 3.
