As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes this construction will promote a hygienic practice in her family.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a resident from Kandal Stoeng district in the Kandal province. She is 58 years old and a widowed mother of three children. Presently, only one kid is under her responsibility.  

To ensure three decent daily meals, and to cover the necessary daily expenses, she grows rice as her main source of income. During her spare time, she also works for others for a fee. Now, she is able to earn about 27,700 KHR per day.  

With this loan, she is a second-time borrower who has repaid back her past loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) already and it has helped her to provide decent food for her kids. Now, she teams up a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a latrine for her family. She strongly believes that she can promote good sanitation practices in her household.

loans.use: to build one decent latrine for her home.

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en: Yean is a 57-year-old citizen from Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province.  She is a widowed mother blessed with seven children.  For the sake of this big family, she grows rice as the primary source of income. Currently, she is able to earn up to 24,200 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Yean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Now, she forms a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can own a proper latrine for her family to promote a good sanitation practice in her household.

loans.use: to build a family latrine.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza manages a general store for a living. She has been running it for more than five years, and she earns well for the family. 

She used her previous loan from GDMPC in purchasing additional products for her store and has successfully repaid it. Recently she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

She always finds ways to augment their living, for she wants the best for her family. She hopes to spend a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn helps her husband in operating their own rice farm to make a living. She has been doing this for eleven years, earning well for the family. 

She joined GDMPC this year, and recently she borrowed a loan to be used in weeding and maintenance costs. She is hopeful enough to gain more income from the farm, and she wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Al-Noor Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Noor Group and it consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hard-working women and they have applied for a combined loan of YER 140,000.

Amal is the leader of the group. She is a 29-year-old, single woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her dad is a worker and he gets a small income that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Amal feels tired when she does the laundry by hand because she doesn’t have enough money to buy a washing machine. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to help her dad to cover the cost of purchasing a washing machine in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to help her dad to cover the cost of purchasing a washing machine in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
Chanra is a resident from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 28 years old and a young mother of two young sons. 

To earn a living, she and her husband grow rice and watermelons as the main source of income. Her household can earn additional income through fishing. Chanra has been involved in the current business for 10 years. 

She has been with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, for the past four loans with successful repayments. This past loan has helped her to provide sufficient food for her kids and to buy household appliances for her family. 

For this loan, she has teamed up as a group of three to obtain a new loan. The total requested amount for her entire group is 3,400,000 KHR of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and watermelon seeds. She hopes to obtain a better yield than before so she is able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher a repeat borrower. She is 40 years old and a resident of Kashasha Itojo, Ntungamo district. She is married with three children. Jenipher is hard-working. In the photo, she is with her daughter on her banana plantation. 

She applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX to improve her farming business. She has the challenge of little business income from her bananas and cows. 

Jenipher decided to come to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for a loan to buy mulch for her plantation so that she can improve her plantation's productivity.

loans.use: to buy mulches

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela lives in Bazmaberd village with her husband, son, and mother-in-law. She is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. Bela and her husband keep chickens, piglets, sheep, cows and calves. They sell the gathered milk and meat locally and earn income for their living. Now, by applying for this loan, Bela requests financial support to purchase 3 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to increase her agricultural income and to have a profitable farm.

Bela received a loan from a local financial institution in the past but was not able, unfortunately, to pay it back. However, thanks to her recent hard work, Bela was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Consequently, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

The loan will be a huge support for Bela and her husband and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy 3 oxen and forage.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is a resident of the Storng district in the Kampong Thom province of Cambodia. She is 51 years old and a mother of six children. Currently, only four children are under her responsibility. To support her family, she grows rice as the main source of income and catches fishes for resale. Now, she is requesting her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to cover her son's school fees at university. She hopes her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to cover her son's school fees at university.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
As a single mother, Amanda sought a way to be financially independent while being able to spend time with her two-year-old daughter as well. She recently learned of microlending from a friend and decided to apply for a loan in order to sell Mary Kay skincare products. The added flexibility in running her own business gave her freedom that a nine-to-five job would not allow. 

“I chose to work with Mary Kay in particular because they believe in giving back to the community,” Amanda said. “Some of the revenue helps abused wives and underprivileged youth. That is very important to me.” 

For Amanda, helping clients select the correct skin care products is very rewarding, as she knows that they can help a person take greater pride in their appearance. She has had success in her sales thus far and takes pride in empowering the women who purchase her products. By hosting “skincare parties” throughout the area, Amanda is able to attract new clients, while bringing women together in a relaxed setting. 

Amanda will use her $800 Kiva loan to purchase inventory for her skincare line. She will also allocate a portion of the funds to host her own website.

Looking to the future, Amanda hopes that her new business will continue to grow and help provide for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to launch her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 38-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family.

Her family is poor. Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She learned this art in her childhood and now she has adopted it as an occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial to her and her family. Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as sequins, pearls, thread, silk and stones for embroidery

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 52-years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with six children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost fifteen years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her profits are usually spent on their daily expenditures and school allowances for her children. Due to insufficient funds to use in her business, she's asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase breads, food seasonings, cooking oil, sugar, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase breads, food seasonings, cooking oil, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and is married  with three kids.

In 2011, Carmelita applied for membership with PMPC. After hearing about all the benefits, she was immediately interested in joining. She is a member in good standing and repays her loans in a timely manner.

Recently, Carmelita is asking for financial assistance with a loan of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase materials house reparations. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger's main source of income comes from his palay (rice) production business. He has been doing this for more than four years, earning money to support his family, and was able to successfully repay his previous loan that he used to improve the farm. 

Aside from farming, he was also occupied with managing his retail business. In order to purchase more grocery goods to resell, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. Roger plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for resale.

loans.name: Cerilyn

texts.en:
Cerilyn is  28 years old, single, and a resident of Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through selling cosmetics. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 8,000.00  to buy additional cosmetics to sell.

Cerilyn deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 47 years old, lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. She was gifted with four children. 

Concepcion is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Concepcion decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already, and recently requested PHP 8,000 for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Concepcion is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. 

She hopes to own additional farmland someday to use for future purposes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and pay labor costs for cultivation.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 61 years old, married, and a resident of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She earns a living through farming.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional fertilizers for her farm.

Nelia deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers for farming.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. This loan is intended to purchase materials for motorcycle renovation.

Inda dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for motorcycle renovation.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Gloria Estefany

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres y con un hermano, vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y el clima que no ayuda mucho.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza y liquidos para matar los insectos. La meta es tener dinero para comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old, and is single with no children. She lives with her parents and her brother, in Mocache Canton in the Province of Los Rios. 

She is a member of the 27 DE OCTUBRE community bank, which is located in the Sara Guerrero neighborhood, in the Moache Canton. They make a living in agriculture and livestock activities.
 
Gloria works in agriculture, growing maize. She buys the things she needs in Mocache in the Thursday market. With the money, she has been able to cover certain necessities such as paying for labor and buying inputs. She faces challenges such as competition and the climate, which doesn't help much. 

She is requesting the loan the buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and pesticides. The aim is to have money to buy plot of land to continue working in agriculture. In her free time she enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dressmaking business in the Philippines.  Letecia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, etc. for her dressmaking business.  She has been in this business for 43 years now.  Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, etc. for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Abadesa

texts.en:
Abadesa works hard to support five children. She is married and has a business, raising pigs, in the Philippines.

Abadesa requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of an emergency.

Abadesa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Dolores Erlinda

texts.es:
Dolores de 31 años de edad, tiene tres hermanos, dos de ellos emigraron hacia Estados Unidos, por la situación de pobreza en que se encontraba su familia, al no poder estudiar decidió dedicarse al comercio desde muy pequeña,  para así poder aportar recursos a los suyos. Es una madre soltera, tiene dos hijos que estudian.

Se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar y ayuda a su hermano en los cultivos de maíz y frijol. Hace varios años vendía frutas y verduras en el mercado, también en el mes de noviembre  elabora flores para venderlas a las personas que van a enflorar sus difuntos.
Se ha criado realizando las actividades agrícolas, sus padres les enseñaron este oficio para que pudieran llevar el pan de cada día al hogar.


El préstamo lo necesita para recolectar, desgranar  y almacenar la cosecha de maíz, ya se llegó la época y no cuentan con los recursos para cubrir con los costos que tienen estas actividades. Al no contar con el dinero ha decido solicitar un crédito, el cual lo pagara de la ganancia que obtendrá al vender la cosecha posteriormente.

Su sueño es que sus dos hijos puedan formarse educativamente y puedan llegar a la universidad, convirtiéndose en unos verdaderos profesionales, porque al prepararse podrán tener mayores y mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Dolores is 31 years old and has three siblings. Two of her siblings emigrated to the US due to the impoverished situation the family was in. As Dolores was not able to study, she had decided to go into business from a very young age so that she could provide for her family. She is a single mother with two children who are studying.
 
She does housework and helps her brother to grow corn and beans. For several years ago she has sold fruits and vegetables at the market, and in the month of November she also grows flowers to sell to people for decorating their loved ones' graves. Dolores has grown up doing agricultural activities - her parents taught her so that they could provide for the family.

Dolores needs the loan to harvest, shuck and stock up on the corn crop, as the season has arrived and they don't have the resources to cover the cost of these activities. As they don't have the money, she has decided to ask for a loan, which she will pay back with the income she gets from selling the harvest afterward.

Dolores' dream is for her two sons to be educated and go to university, becoming real professional people, because with preparatiion they will get bigger and better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to harvest her crop of corn.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from the Garnahovit village of the Aragatsotn region. Because of severe climate conditions, locals here are mainly involved in cattle breeding. She and her family are also keeping livestock, including chickens, pigs, cows, sheep, and calves, as well as cultivating grass as forage for animals.

Anahit lives together with her two sons (ages 16 and 14 years old) and parents in law who are retired. Anahit's sons help their mother with farming activities. Anahit requested this loan for improving her farm. The loan will help her to purchase two piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to gather more income, ensuring better living conditions for her family. 

As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Anahit waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kenja

texts.ru: Кенча добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 54 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Кенча живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом. Кенча занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Кенча занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и выращивать скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Кенча хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Кенча заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Kenja is a good-natured and good-humored man of the age of 54 years. He is married and has two children. Kenja lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. In order to feed his family, he has his own business.

Kenja works as a dekhan farmer and with livestock breeding. He has a land area. Out of the whole area, some of the land is rain fed and the rest is irrigated. On this land, Kenja grows carrots, potatoes and cereals. His wife helps him care for and breed cattle. As they have a large land area, they also let their cattle graze on it.

The livestock breeding business brings in a good income, and therefore Kenja would like to expand the business by increasing the number of livestock. For this, he turned to Arvand in order to receive a loan to purchase livestock. Kenja thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en el 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Además forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
La Sra. Graciela es parte de este grupo, quien comenta que entre el trabajo que ella hace se dedica a la venta de ropas, de todo tipo, con lo cual tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Dice que por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo mejorar y crecer bastante. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda de ropas, y es por eso que viene luchando.
Graciela solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas de variadas clases,  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, además agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" group is on its second loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme.  All the members are working and helping each other to get ahead.  The women are also part of the poverty elimination programme.

Graciela is a member of this group and she tells us that she makes a living selling all types of clothes.  This works provides her with an income with which to help her family.  Graciela says that, through her efforts and sacrifice, she has improved and expanded her business a lot.  Graciela is fighting for her dream of having a clothes shop.

Graciela is applying for a loan in order to buy various types of clothing, which will help her to realise her business plan.  This will allow Graciela to increase her income.  Graciela is grateful for the support she is receiving - it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tajy Poty está en su quinto ciclo del programa de comité, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital, que aún está en crecimiento, y donde cada una quiere que su ciudad vaya creciendo.
Marisel, es peluquera y comenta que su negocio fue creciendo lentamente gracias al esfuerzo que hizo, y hoy en día ya tiene una muy buena clientela, y quiere poder seguir creciendo para seguir apoyando a su familia.
La Sra. Marisel  Solicito el crédito para la compra de Productos para su peluquera, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Tajy Poty" group is on its fifth loan cycle with the committee programme.  The group's members come from Curuguaty,  Although quite far from the capital, Curuguaty is still growing and each member of the group wants it to grow.

Marisel is a hairdresser and tells us that her business has slowly grown because of her efforts and she now has a good customer base and wants to continue expanding in order to continue supporting her family.

Marisel is applying for this loan in order to buy products, such as dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams, and more, for her hair salon.  This will help to make her business plan a reality, allowing her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams, and more.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling soft drinks in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Julie has requested a loan to buy cartons of canned soft drinks, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, and strawberry, and a cooler. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Julie will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of canned soft drinks, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, and strawberry, and a cooler.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles raises and sells pigs for a living and she's been in this business more than six  years, earning well for the family, and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used it in  purchasing feed. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase feed in order to boost her pigs. Angeles simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Chellome

texts.en:
Chellome, 35 , is married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She has four children.

From her desire to help the family, she opened her own fruit stand, starting it up with an investment of 3,000 PHP. She has been operating it successfully for two years. Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 5,000.00 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member a year ago. She  wants to have a stall in the public market to display her fruits. What would make her most happy would be seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional products to stock her fruit stall.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 56 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is widow with six adult-aged children.  

Vivian has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy piglets.

Vivian has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Nodilyn

texts.en:
Nodilyn is 27 years old, and lives in Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is married and has two school-age children.  Nodilyn has a hog fattening business.  She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to buy feeds.
 
Nodilyn has been a member of PMPC for six months. In the future, Nodilyn hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds.

location.town: Ozamis-Purok 1 Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Floripes

texts.en:
Floripes is 60 years old. She is married with five adult children. She lives in Poblacion Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. Floripes has engaged in a sari-sari store (small general store)  in town and earned a monthly income of PHP 6,500.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy more inventory for her sari-sari store, like basic commodities. Floripes is a good member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys the benefit of being a PMPC member.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her sari-sari store, like basic commodities

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 54 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She lives in Delapa Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a farmer and she has engaged in a sari-sari store business for five years, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Marlyn requested a new loan to purchase stocks for her business, such as beverages and various groceries. She wants to earn more out of her business and save for future use, with her husband. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a year now.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari-store.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима живет в городе Исфара с мужем и дочерью. Ей 54 года. Она портниха и занимается швейным делом у себя дома. Рахима знает профессию швеи еще с детства когда помогала матери с шитьем, но начала зарабатывать на этом недавно. Только два года как она берет заказы на шитье женских национальных платьев. Рахима целеустремленная женщина. Сейчас она собирается расширить свое дело и купить модернизированную швейную машинку. Для реализации этой цели она просит кредит и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahima lives in the city of Isfara together with her husband and daughter. She is 54 years old. She is a seamstress and has a sewing business at home.

Rahima has known the profession of sewing since her childhood, when she helped her mother with sewing, but started working with it not long ago. She has only taken orders for two years, for sewing women's national dresses.

Rahima is a purposeful woman. Currently she has decided to expand her business and purchase a modern sewing machine. To realize this goal, she requests a loan and hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for expanding her sewing business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single with no children and takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more clothes.  She has been in this business for three years and sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She generates additional income from working as a hairdresser. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a forty-year-old, hardworking, married man, with seven children living in Hoima,Uganda. He operates a retail shop where he mainly sells agricultural produce and he receives additional income from a transport business. Gerald is a  hardworking man who desires to educate his children. Price fluctuations and bad roads are his major challenges. He is requesting a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jeramie requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of an emergency. Jeramie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Luz Omaira

texts.es:
Luz Omaira, a sus 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años, al cual ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo, dedicación, amor y paciencia, pues tiene dificultades cognitivas y de atención, que han sido todo un desafío manejar.
Durante su vida productiva trabajó varios años como mesera en diferentes restaurantes pero, hace 8 años tuvo la oportunidad de independizarse al recibir como herencia una cafetería que era propiedad de su padre ya fallecido. Allí trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7 am a 7 pm y tiene como ventaja los 24 años de trayectoria que lleva en funcionamiento el establecimiento, por lo que ya es reconocido en la zona.
El crédito que solicita lo utilizará para comprar vitrinas y realizar adecuaciones locativas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del establecimiento, cambiando la percepción de los transeúntes, quienes pueden sentirse más atraídos y ser clientes potenciales.
Luz manifiesta que seguirá luchando para sacar adelante el negocio y ser más productiva y competitiva en el mercado, así estará en la capacidad de ofrecer un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su hijo y además el establecimiento será un legado que recibirá su hijo cuando crezca.
texts.en:
Luz Omaira, 33 years old, is a single mother of a 9-year-old son, who she has provided for with effort, dedication, love, and patience, as he has cognitive and attention deficits which have been quite a challenge to deal with.
During her working life, she worked for several years as a waitress in different restaurants, but 8 years ago she had the opportunity to become independent when she inherited a café that had been owned by her late father. She works there from Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 7 pm, and she has the advantage of the fact that the establishment is well known in the area since it has been in business for 24 years.
She will use the requested loan to buy shop windows and make some modifications, which will allow her to improve the look of the establishment, thus changing the perception of passers-by who might be more attracted and be potential customers.
Luz states that she will continue to strive to make the business a success and to be more productive and competitive in the market; in this way, she will be able to offer her son a better sense of well-being and quality of life, and in addition the establishment will be an inheritance that her son will receive when he grows up.

loans.use: to buy shop windows and make some modifications.

loans.name: Luis Rodrigo

texts.es:
Luis un hombre ecuatoriano de 24 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  este joven es muy emprendedor y trabajador desde muy niño fue un gran apoyo para su madre vive en unión libre tiene un pequeño hijo de seis meses de edad , viven en asa propia en un sector rural de la ciudad de Latacunga, este sector se llama Ortuño  sector conocido por ser una zona ganadera y láctea.
Por falta de recursos económicos de sus padre Luis solo pudo terminar la secundaria, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ponerse a trabajar ya que a mas de dedicarse a la crianza y venta de cerdos también trabaja en una plantación desde hace ya varios años,  y  hoy se dedica junto a su esposa  a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Son una pareja muy trabajadora y han sacado a su pequeño  hijo adelante, tienen una casita propia en donde viven juntos.
Luis requiere un crédito  para invertir en el mejoramiento de su pequeña casa, y esto será para que tengan mayor comodidad. 
Ellos agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24 year-old Ecuadorian man, born in the city of Latacunga in the Cotopaxi province. This young man is very enterprising and hardworking, and from a very young age he was a great help to his mother. He lives in a common-law marriage and has a small son who is six months old. The family lives in their own home in a rural area of Latacunga called Ortuño, an area known for livestock and dairy production.

Due to a lack of resources, Luis could not continue his education after high school, but this has not stopped him from working, since in addition to raising and selling pigs, he has also worked on a plantation for several years. Now he works with his wife, raising and selling small animals. They are a very hardworking couple and they have provided for their son, and they have their own little house where they live together.

Luis needs a loan to invest in improvements to their little house and make it more comfortable. He and his wife are grateful to "Fundación Alternativa" in Ecuador and to Kiva for making this growth possible in their professional and personal lives.

loans.use: to invest in improvements to his small house.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Soy is 40 years old and a mother of five children who are still in school. To tackle the daily cost of living, she grows rice and raises ducks, and works as a schoolteacher as the main source of income. Now, she is able to earn up to US $5 per day.  

This is the fourth-cycle loan for Soy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success, and it has helped her to support her business and to keep her kids in school. 

Now, she wants to focus on her daughter’s education. Hence, she applied for an education loan to cover the school fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the school fee for her daughter.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora earns a living by managing a general store, and has been doing this for the past seven years. She is able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan.

She used this loan to improve her inventory. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase grocery goods for resale. She hopes to earn more income and wants to improve her business so that she can have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites owns and operates a general store, selling grocery products to earn a living.  She's been in this business more than six years. She earns well for the family, and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. She used this loan in purchasing goods for sale. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. In the future, she hopes for business improvements and to be able to provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Necel

texts.en:
Necel helps her husband manage their own farm for a living and has been doing this for more than four years, earning well for the family, and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she needs to buy new seeds and fertilizer to improve the farm. Without hesitation, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit which helped her to improve her ability to engage in business. She hopes to improve her farm so she can have a stable source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kolla Marka Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KOLLA MARKA”  iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trabajo en porcela fría, bisutería, costura de chamarras, lechería, confección de balones, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, reposterías, tejido de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florencia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de balones; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, hace veinte años, cuando emprendieron su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir en su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kolla Marka" will begin its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Point of Alto Lima. It is composed of ten members and is run by a board which has Florencia as the President.

The businesses that the members of the association are running are varied. Among them are: cold porcelain works, costume jewelry, sewing of ponchos, a dairy, making balls, a neighborhood store, vegetable sales, pastries and cloth weaving.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen, of which Florencia is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago, by invitation of a friend who is a partner in the institution. She currently has a business sewing balls. She said that she learned this business from her husband, 20 years ago, when they started their own workshop.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (buying leather) that she will get from wholesale stores in La Paz, and subsequently for production. She will sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to sustain her home, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the sharing in her community bank.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies     dans la ville de BLA dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers, des grains de céréales, des savons et de la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire. ZARAHOU 2 eme  femme debout à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  50kg de maïs, 50kg de fonio, 100kg de riz non décortiqué. Elle s’approvisionne à BLA pendant les jours des foires. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group TIESSIRI average 40 years of age and four children each. They live in extended traditional families in the city of BLA, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another through ties of kinship. Their activities include the purchase and sale of various merchandise, grains, cereals, and soap, as well as restaurant services. 

Having correctly repaid their past loans, the group members are now seeking a 2nd loan as a group. ZARAHOU, standing second from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 50 kg of maize, 50 kg of fonio, and 100 kg of raw rice. She buys her stock at the fair in BLA. She sells for cash, often on credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 11,000FCFA, which she will use to cover expenses pertaining to healthcare and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activities.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 25 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling coconut drink and soft drinks in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Elisabeth has requested a loan to buy two coolers and soft drinks, such as Coke, Sprite, Fanta and root beer. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elisabeth will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy two coolers and soft drinks, such as Coke, Sprite, Fanta and root beer.

loans.name: Mercy Gay

texts.en: Mercy Gay  is 34 years old and has two children in grade school. Her husband works as a tricycle driver to meet their daily needs. She lives in Poblacion Sibutad Zamboanga Del Norte. Mercy Gay has a snack vending business and earns a monthly income of 3000 PHP. She requested a new loan to purchase ingredients to make bread with pansit (noodles) and ice candy. She is a member of Paglaum MPC hoping to save more for her kids.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 32 years old, married with two children and lives in Cebulin, Paridel, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Anaou has a pig-raising business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. Analou has been a member of PMPC for six years.
In the future, Anaou hopes to have enough savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esterlito

texts.en:
Esterlito is 59 years old and lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with two children. 
Esterlito runs a grocery shop to earn a living. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan to purchase stocks of goods for his store.
Esterito has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Esterlito hopes to have enough savings for his future retirement.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods for his grocery store.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 29 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 
To make a living, Joan runs a mini grocery store. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase stocks of goods to sell in her mini grocery store..
Joan has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Joan hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods to sell in her mini grocery store.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 57 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 
Luzminda works in the fishing industry, catching fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.. 
Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Luzminda hopes to have another new pumpboat.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is single, 51 years old, and lives in Bato - Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  He is a farmer, and grows rice to earn a living.  Arnold has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs, like fertilizers and pesticide.

Arnold has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Arnold hopes to have enough savings for his future retirement.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodeyn is 26 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rodelyn is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living, which she has been doing for eight years. 

Rodeyn is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticide.  Rodelyn has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to acquire another rice farm for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 55 years old and lives in Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Roberta has a shop that sells nipa hut leaves (thatch made of leaves of the nipa palm). She has had this business for 30 years. 

She requested a loan to purchase bundles of nipa leaves and bamboo.

Roberta has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Roberta hopes to have enough savings to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of nipa leaves and bamboo.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is single with one child. She is 50 years old, and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Andresa is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living; she has been doing this for 12 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional feed.

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for eight years. 

In the future, Andresa hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with three children; she is 60 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Evangeline is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional feed.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es: Jackelin,  de 32 años de edad, está casada con Justo y tiene una hija de 03 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Jackelin tiene un consultorio odontológico donde brinda servicio de curación dental, y demás servicios. Ella es odontóloga de profesión y quiso tener su propio negocio y ser independiente. Lo viene realizando en su casa en un local bien implementado desde hace más de 04 años, al mismo tiempo cuenta con una botica con los medicamentos necesarios para los tratamientos dentales. Cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja en la atención al público en las tardes, pues la remplaza ya que ella es docente universitaria y dicta clases a esas horas. Le gusta atender y hacer un bien a las personas que necesitan de ella. Antes de iniciar con ésta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos pues con las ganancias de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2500. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. El monto solicitado los invertirá  en la compra de medicamentos y materiales dentales como silicona para realizar prótesis.
texts.en:
Jackelin is 32 years old. She is married to Justo and has a 3 year old daughter whom she lives with in their own home. Jackelin has a dental practice where she offers dental treatment and other services. She is a dentist by profession and she wanted to have her own business and to be independent. 4 years ago she decided to start a practice in her home, in a well equipped place. She also has a pharmacy with the necessary medicines for dental treatments. Her partner helps with patients in the afternoons, then he replaces her, as she is a university lecturer and takes classes at those times.

Jackelin enjoys looking after and helping people who need her. Before starting this career she had a lot of financial problems because her husband's income was not enough to cover the household expenses. With this opportunity she is asking for 2,500 PEN. With your help she intends to make her plans concrete. The amount requested will be invested in buying medicines and dental materials such as silicon for dentures.

loans.use: buy medicines and dental products.

loans.name: Izobikora Group

texts.fr:
Boniface fait partie du groupe Izobikora  et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Pascasie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 7  à 22 ans.
Il prend soins de 2 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Il  est tailleur, et commerçant des tissus depuis 18ans.

C'est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  40 tissus, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait faire l’élevage de chèvres et ouvrir les comptes de dépôt des enfants et les voir étudier.
texts.en:
Boniface is part of the Izobikora group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 52 years of age and married to a farmer named Pascasie. Together they have four children aged between 7 and 22. 

Boniface takes care of two of his children, one of whom is at school. He is a tailor, and has worked selling fabrics for 18 years. This is his first loan from Turame, and he plans to use his Kiva loan to increase his capital, buying 40 lengths of fabric to resell and earn more income.

Over the coming years Boniface would like to work rearing goats, as well as to open deposit accounts for his children and ensure that they continue with their education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy 40 lengths of fabric for resale

loans.name: Kabumenge Group

texts.fr:
Gilbert fait partie du groupe Kabumenge et habite à Cibitoke. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Josélyne,  une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 7 à 9 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 4ans.

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits , à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines années, il voudrait construire une belle maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gilbert is part of the Kabumenge group, and lives in Cibitoke. He is 40 years of age and married to Josélyne, a retailer. Together they have four children aged between 7 and 9, three of whom are at school. 

Gilbert has worked selling clothing for four years, and this is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he plans to increase his capital by buying lots of clothing, which he will resell to earn more. Over the coming years he would like to build a nice home from durable materials, as well as to ensure his children get an education.

loans.use: to increase his capital, buying a lot of clothing to resell and earn more

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Замиры - среднее образование, она домохозяйка, счастливая мать и хорошая супруга. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замира занимается животноводством, этой отраслью она занимается на протяжении многих лет, имеет определенные результаты. Стартовала 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 60 овец, 3 лошади. Для содержания скота имеются все условия, сарай для содержания скота, и отгонные пастбища. Сено и корм собирают со своего земельного надела. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zamira is 47 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Zamira has secondary education. She is a housewife, a happy mother and a good wife. 

As a main source of income for her family, Zamira works with livestock breeding. She has worked with this activity for many years, with positive results. She started 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamira's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, 60 sheep and three horses. She has all conditions for keeping livestock: A barn for keeping livestock and pastures. They harvest hay and forage on their own plot of land. The monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Zamira turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Zamira plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is married with three children.  She is 28 years old, and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines.  Annie sells assorted products to earn a living.  She has had this business for 10 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,500 to restock her store with basic commodities.
Annie has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Annie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Elphas is married and has six children. He recently retired from forestry and is now focused on farming his land. He is currently growing maize, beans, sunflower, sorghum, and mangoes and also rears dairy goats and local cows. 

This is Elphas’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to upgrade from a mud house to a more permanent house. He would like to thank Kiva lenders for their support, and he says “come after five years to see the development through this program.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 60-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anastacia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like pork, chicken, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 53 years old and married, with two children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

Mercy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and she also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Mercy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Neresa

texts.en:
Neresa works hard to support ten children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Neresa requested a PHP 7,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up lighting, in case of emergency.

Neresa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Hoima, Uganda.  She is 31 years old. She is married with a responsibility of taking care of four children. Sarah runs a restaurant, which operates six days a week. Sarah earns additional income from farming. She started the business so as to improve her livelihood.  She is a hardworking woman, who desires to expand her business into new markets. However, fluctuating prices affect her business. She is acquiring a loan to complete her house.

loans.use: to complete her house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old and he lives with his parents and his three brothers. Ali, along with his father and two of his brothers, provides the family income.

Ali is a tailor. He specializes in tailoring shirts. Ali gained his experience in tailoring from his mother, who supported and guided him through every step of his learning. In 2010, after gaining all the needed experience, Ali established his own independent business. He now has a hired employee and he is well-known in the neighborhood, with an excellent reputation.

Ali is applying for a youth loan of USD 2,400. The aim of this loan is to renovate Ali's workplace and to pay the annual rent of his shop. Ali believes that this loan will positively effect the growth of his business and will provide him with a better income.

loans.use: to renovate his workplace and to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 25 años de edad, es acompañado, su esposa en ocasiones le ayuda en el negocio, la  mayor parte  de tiempo la pasa en los oficios del hogar, tiene una hija de 5 años aproximadamente, quien aún no asiste a la escuela, el cliente vive con toda su familia (padres, hermanos) en el mismo terreno pero diferente vivienda, de él solo dependen la esposa y su hija. 

Juan de pequeño se dedica al comercio de ropa de forma ambulante, lo aprendió de su madre quien aún se dedica al comercio. Él comercializa su mercadería en el pueblo donde vive y en otros 4 pueblos vecinos, viaja en bus a comprar y a vender, su esposa y un hermano le apoyan, trabaja todos los días de la semana, de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm

Una parte del crédito lo utilizara, para pagar un crédito que tiene en un banco, pues cree que le han dado un interés muy alto, la otra parte para comprar más mercadería para el negocio (ropa de todo tipo para niños y adultos), el crédito le ayudara mucho pues dejara de pagar unos dólares de mas, y lo podrá invertir en su querida hija.  

Su meta es darle a su familia una mejor vivienda, pues con la que cuenta está cerrada con láminas, por lo que cada día compra materiales como bloques, hierro, arena etc., para poco a poco completar en un futuro los materiales y poder hacerla de otro material, también quiere que su hija sea profesional, que sueña con verla en una oficina trabajando y no como el vendiendo en las calles del pueblo, piensa que ahora que encontró a credicampo sus metas se ven más cortas, ya que son una institución honesta y con un interés muy bajo, con buenas oportunidades para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old and is married.  His wife sometimes helps him with his business, but spends most of her time doing housework.  They have a 5 year old daughter who is not yet in school.  Juan live with his whole family (parents, brothers) on the same land but in different houses.  Only his wife and daughter depend on him.  

From a young age, Juan has worked selling clothing door-to-door.  He learned this trade from his mother, who still works in this field.  He sells his merchandise in the town that he lives in, as well as in four neighboring towns.  He travels by bus to buy and sell his products.  With the support of his wife and one of his brothers, he works every day from 6 am to 3 pm.  

He will use part of the loan to pay off a loan that he has with a bank, for which he believes he is being charged an interest rate that is too high.  The rest of the loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for his business (all types of clothing for children and adults).  The loan will be very helpful because it will allow him to save money and invest it in his daughter.  

His goal is to give his family a better home, as the one they currently live in has sheet metal walls.  Everyday, he buys materials such as bricks, iron, sand, etc. so that little by little he can accumulate the materials he needs to build a house.  He also wants his daughter to be a professional, he dreams of seeing her work in an office, not like him, selling in the streets of their town.  He thinks that now that he has found credicampo, his goals are within reach.  With an honest institution and a lower interest rate, he has good opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay off a loan that he has with a bank, for which he believes he is being charged an interest rate that is too high.  The rest of the loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for his business (all types of clothing for children and adults).  The loan will be very helpful because it will allow him to save money and invest it in his daughter.

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak is a resident of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is 25 years old and a young mother of one dependent child. For the sake of her family, she does rice cropping on a half-hectare plot of farmland as a single source of income.  

Now, she is in her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With a successful repayment of her past loan, she has managed to improve for a good living condition in her household. 

Now, she formed a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the reaping fee for her crop. She hopes that she can collect her yield in a timely manner and with a good income in return.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees for her rice crop.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 55 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Petronila has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Petronila has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for snack vending.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Petronila would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Andrita

texts.en:
Andrita is married with five children. She is 40 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Andrita is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Andrita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is married with two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Shella sells load wallet to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy additional load wallet.

Shella has been a member of PMPC for seven months.  In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income and to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy additional load wallet

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with four children. She is 38 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Liza sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Liza hopes to supplement her family's income and to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Mariniel

texts.en:
Mariniel owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living; she has been doing this for more than six years, earning well for the family. 

She was able to repay her previous loan successfully, through her efforts from doing business diligently. 

She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with five children. She is 45 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Alicia sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock store with basic commodities. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es: Doña Johana es habitante de una zona marginal de Managua, labora vendiendo ropa variada de manera ambulante en los mercados de Managua, y su esposo es conductor de camiones, la señora solicita el crédito para instalación de un segundo  servicio higiénico en la parte exterior de su casa, con el apoyo del financiamiento comprara los materiales: inodoro, bloque, cemento arena, piedrín, tuberías, laminas  de zinc y perlines.
texts.en:
Johana is a resident of an area on the outskirts of Managua.  She works selling miscellaneous clothing in the markets of Managua.  Her husband is a truck driver.  

She is seeking a loan to install a second toilet on the outside of her home.  With the financial support, she will purchase the following materials: toilet, blocks, cement, sand, stones, plumbing, zinc sheets and purlins.

loans.use: purchase materials such as: a toilet, blocks, cement, sand, stones, plumbing, zinc sheets and purlins,

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura, de 51  años de edad, está divorciada del padre de sus hijos y vive en compañía de sus 03 hijos y su nuera en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Maura es la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros, para eso cuenta con una tienda instalada en su propia casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Iniciándose hace más de 10 años con un capital propio viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional y hasta el momento  lo realiza sola en la atención a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa, atender a sus hijos y el tiempo libre que lo pueda emplear en otras actividades, igualmente los ingresos económicos que le generan los cuales usa en los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado,  no le gusta  que algunos de sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras a lo que ella se niega pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con éste tipo de venta, por lo que todas sus ventas son al contando, y puede ver más rápidos sus ganancia. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, aceite, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Maura is 51 years old, is divorced from the father of her children, and lives with her three children and her daughter in law in a house that she owns.  Maura works selling basic food items such as: rice, sugar, pasta, oils and others.  She has a store in her house where she tends to her customers very kindly.  

She started her business more than 10 years ago with her own money, after seeing that she was in need of additional income.  To this day, she runs it on her own.  She enjoys her business as it allows her to be in the comfort of her home, taken care of her children, and use her free time for other activities.  IN addition, she is able to use the earnings for household expenses.  She does not like when her customers ask to buy products from her on credit because she has had bad experiences, therefore all of her sales are in cash, which also allows her to keep better track of her earnings.  

She is taking this opportunity to seek a loan of 1500 soles that she hopes will allow her to make her plans concrete.  She is committed to making the loan repayments on time.  She will use the loan to purchase food items such as: rice, oil and sugar.

loans.use: purchase food products such as rice, oil and sugar among others.

loans.name: Dusangirimizi Group

texts.fr:
Adèle fait partie du groupe Dusangirimizi et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Claude,  un maçon. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 4 à 5 ans, dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, les unités téléphoniques,…)  depuis  2 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à  revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, elle  voudrait  acheter des motos de transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adèle is part of the Dusangirimizi group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 27 years of age and married to a builder named Claude. Together they have three children aged between 4 and 5, one of whom is at school.

Adèle has worked selling store items (rice, beans, phone credit) for the past two years. This is her first loan from Turame, and she plans to use the loan she gets from Kiva to increase her capital, buying lots of clothing to sell and earn more. Over the coming years, she would like to buy motorbikes for transportation, as well as ensure that her children get an education.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying lots of clothing, which she will resell to earn more

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. 

Pamela is married and has five children. Her husband is engaged in a livestock business, while Pamela herself runs a small kiosk selling consumable goods. Pamela has been farming for 12 years and is currently growing maize, beans, groundnuts, sunflower, and millet, as well as raising cows, dairy goats, and sheep. She likes beekeeping because she believes honey is a good food that is nutritious and can cure coughs. 

This is Pamela’s first loan, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Her hope for the future is to expand her business and to be in amaranth farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County.  Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three East African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people.  A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares.  Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education.  As a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

James is married, and has ten children. James farms and engages in grain banking, while his wife also farms and sells fish in the market. He has been farming for thirty years, and is currently growing amaranth, maize, beans, tomatoes, sorghum, millet and sunflowers on his land. He thinks that beekeeping is a good project, because not only is it a good source of income, it also improves forest cover and produces honey, a food with medicinal properties. 

This is James’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay his children’s school fees and increase his farming activities. His hope for the future is “to have highly educated children.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity, 38 years old, is a single mother of one beautiful child, aged 13. She has been operating a retail shop and a green grocer in Naivasha for five years. Purity has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy stocks of sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc. for her business. 

Purity plans to use the anticipated profit to make more savings with VisionFund and to repay the loan. In the near future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Mariam has operated a business selling herbal medicine for 4 years. She generates additional income from selling used shoes. Mariam goes door-to-door selling herbal medicine six days every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  

Mariam has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more herbal medicine. She hopes to get a permanent business premise and to buy a plot of land and build her own house. Mariam resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more herbal medicine.

loans.name: Dalila Rosa

texts.es:
Dalila, a sus 44 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer pujante, dedicada y con proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la confección, inició como empleada en diferentes talleres y empresas, allí adquirió experiencia y conocimientos, además logró reunir el dinero suficiente para independizarse y montar su propio taller, allí presta el servicio de confección a terceros, cuenta con el apoyo de 8 empleadas madres cabeza de hogar y trabajan de 8 am a 6 pm; tiene la ventaja de ser reconocida por su trayectoria, pues lleva 21 años como independiente, generando ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y con la educación de sus dos hijos.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de unas guías para confección e insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, entre otros), esto le permitirá optimizar el tiempo y agilizar la producción para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes, abriendo paso para adquirir nuevos contratos y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio.
Dalila manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad al negocio, con todos los insumos necesarios para dar agilidad a su proceso de producción y seguir generando una excelente imagen y reconocimiento en el gremio, además estará en la capacidad de mejorar la calidad de vida y disfrutar un mejor bienestar con su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Dalila is 44 years old and is known to be a strong, dedicated woman with a drive to reach her goals.  During her productive life, she has worked as a tailor.
